reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Grand Paradiso from 15th June till 22nd June 2012 in room 403 and it was paradise indeed. Everything about this hotel is special, the views from the hotel over Sorrento and the Bay of Naples are simply breathtaking. Arriving at reception you are greeting by very warm ,friendly and professional staff. We had booked a room at the front of the hotel with seaview unfortunately this was not ready but we were asurred we would be moved there after breakfast the next morning which we were and were given nice bottle of fizz to make up for it, it was a very minor thing and handled beautifully by Alberto. Even although we arrived late there was a lovely cold plate of food waiting for us in the room. Once in our own room the next morning we couldn't believe our luck, our balcony had the same panoramic breathtaking views and was very private. The best thing about Grand Paradiso though is the staff, they are all amazing and made us feel so welcome with nothing too much trouble. Lovely Lawra (hope my spelling not too bad) who seems to keep the whole hotel immaculatetly clean and always has a smile for you, Mekel (olympic standard cocktail maker) who is just a joy, his laughter fills the hotel when he comes to work. The lovely girls who assist him in running the bar so well.The always dapper Giuseppe who's easy charm makes dining at the hotel a lovely experience. All the boys in the resturaunt are very professional and are all characters, they make service so slick both breakfast and dinner were delightful. We also can't speak highly enough of the food at the hotel every meal we had was delicious and varied and to have table service instead of the usual buffet at dinner was a real treat. The courtesy bus is another brilliant service that the hotel provides and is excellent dropping off in the center of Sorrento, big thank you to Mario the driver and hats off to him for negotiating that tight bending road on a daily basis. We are hoping return to the hotel next year and will book the same room if possible or 404 might be our choice. We have wondrful memories of days spent around the pool taking in the amazing view and nights of great food, wine and good company. Once again a great big thank you to all at Grand Paradiso, you made our holiday perfect!! June & duncan Fergusson
reviews.title: Paradiso - A Very Special Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at our hotel late Friday evening at 10pm to find our room (220) and bathroom dirty (hair everywhere), with used towels, ruffled bed and dirty bed sheets. The balcony view was of someone’s back yard and the balcony floor itself was dirty. Having complained to the receptionists, they agreed to clean the room that evening and move us to another room the following morning. The following morning we were moved to another room (316), that again didn’t meet our expectations or live up to the 4 star standard. The air con was noisy, the tv didn’t work and the plug in the sink was stuck. The rooms themselves were generally very old fashioned (decoration) and looked nothing like the pictures on the hotel website. Very disappointing! This view was shared by several other residents who had encountered similar problems/issues. On a positive note, all staff including the restaurant staff (especially Guiseppe!) were very friendly, however the restaurant food lacked variation from evening to evening and lacked Italian cuisine. We found the hotel manager very rude, patronising and inconsiderate to our entitled needs/requests. The views from the pool are spectacular and Sorrento itself is a beautiful place and would highly recommend a visit to this city. Given the poor standard of this hotel we unfortunately can not recommend this hotel as a place to stay. Thank you.
reviews.title: Gran disappointo!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 10 days at the Art Hotel Gran Paradiso in late June. The hotel is high up in Sorrento. The non sea view rooms are basic but comfortable, however the views from the hotel pool and bar area across the Bay of Napes and Mount Versuvius are spectacular. The hotel provides a courtesy bus into town - which is a must as the climb is incredibly steep and long.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel are very helpful and work extremely hard. The food is amazing and the restaurant staff are excellent. Particular mention to Michaella and Narna (apologies for spelling) who work in the poolside bar.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for our honeymoon,great hotel with great views over sorrento and bay of naples due to it being up a big hill,the hill is a bugger to walk up but there is a free bus service running very regularly from the hotel,our only criticismn was that the bus had no air-con which is much needed when you have 20+ people on board and its 32 degrees outside,we nicknamed the bus dante's bus after dante's inferno.. Other than that it was faultless. Tip.. The bus runs to sorrento town centre but if you want to go to saint agnello driver will drop off and pick up at big tree at the bottom of the hill if you ask.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would like to thank all the staff for making our stay the most enjoyable, especially Alberto at the reception.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a standard room, and even if we did not get a sea view, we have enjoyed our time in Sorrento. The pool was breathtaking and the restaurant by the pool was of a good quality and fresh ingredients.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in a beautiful place
Thank God for the shuttle bus!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Gran Paradiso for a week at the end of May, and we couldn't have asked for more. The hotel is clean, spacious and has beautiful art everywhere you look, including an art gallery underneath the restaurant. Our room was lovely, bright and and comfortable, and when I asked if the two twin beds could be made into a double bed, the staff did this straight away with no hassle. The pool area is amazing, with breath taking views of the whole of the Bay of Naples, Vesuvius and Capri - the sunsets every night were stunning. The pool bar was great, as was the restaurant for our evening meals - we had a three course meal each night and the waiters were really lovely. The only slight, slight issue for some people may be that the hotel is half way up a mountain! It's a very steep and winding road that we quite enjoyed walking down, but walking up was tough (and we are two quite fit 25 year olds!). The hotel do, however, provide a free shuttle bus service from the hotel doors to the centre of Sorrento and back about 12 times a day. I've already started recommending this hotel to all my family and friends, and would return in a heart beat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel using our Avios (Airmiles) points, this may have been why we were shown to a room outside the main hotel building, below the pool, with the promised sea view hidden behind the grass bank outside. We complained immediately to the staff at reception who regrettably couldn't provide us with an alternative until the following day. The alternative was better, however being on the first floor directly above the main entrance did mean that it was quite noisy with the window open. The breakfast was ok, but keep clear of the waiters offer of coffee, the coffee from the machine at the buffet is much better. We can't comment on the evening meal as we tended to eat in Sorrento before catching the shuttle bus back up to the hotel. The shuttle bus is a Godsend at the hotel as it stands hish above San Agnello, and quite a walk down to Sorrento, let alone back up the hill. We were full of admiration for the bus driver who managed to negotiate the narrow lane down to San Agnello without hitting any of the parked cars, the side panels on the bus bear witness that it isn't always the case. The hotel, and the swimming pool in particular, has a superb panoramic view of the Bay of Naples fom Capri to Ischia, with Vesuvius looming in the distance. We flew with Easyjet from Bristol and due to it's late arrival in Naples didn't want to risk missing the last train from Naples to Sorrento. We booked our transfer with Giovanni of Johnny's Tours, great service and at €80 as cheap as we could find. We did however catch the airport bus back from Sorrento, much cheaper and a very good service.
reviews.title: superb hotel

reviews.text: just returned from having a wonderful time at the gran paradiso. everything about this hotel was fantastic, the views overlooking the bay of naples is truely breathtaking,the room was very comfortable with a large balcony with sea views,the food and restaurant staff was 1st class. All staff were very friendly , we will definately return !
reviews.title: Could have been better but overall still had wonderful time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 3 nights here at this lovely hotel. Originally we were looking to stay in the centre of Sorrento, but the price and photos we had seen of the hotel made our decision. We were not disappointed. Our room was very spacious, clean and nicely renovated with a lovely large balconly to admire some truly spectacular views. Yes, it is located out of the centre of Sorrento but the hotel does provide a free shuttle bus into the Sorrento train station (very near the centre of town) nearly every hour. We had no issues there - and besides the narrow road leading up to the hotel was an experience in itself! The staff were very accommodating and friendly. The buffet breakfast was well stocked with a good variety. The pool was lovely - spectacular views - and it was lovely to sit by the pool with a drink and relax. Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely location, great hotel

reviews.text: We stayed a week in this hotel in Sorrento and had a fantastic holiday. To start with the staff are really friendly and helpful, as well as the maids ensuring the rooms are always kept clean every day. Fresh towels everyday if you want them! You also have slippers provided and beach towels to use for the week.
reviews.title: Brill holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the hotel is lovely, first holiday in a while I haven't had a bad stomach! The restaurant is waiter served and you have a choice of 4 starters, 4 main dishes and deserts. The food seems as if it is cooked whilst orders come through rather than pre-done or frozen!
reviews.title: A little disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views from the hotel pool are stunning, overlooking the sea and Mount Vesuvius. There is a mini-bus from the hotel (free-of-charge) that regularly takes guests from the hotel down to Sorrento town.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Beautiful Views, Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definately go to this hotel again and would recommend it to young romantic couples, older couples and families with older children. The kids facilities are none-existent so I would not recommend this hotel for young families, also with it not been great for push chairs on and off the mini-bus to Sorrento!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our holiday at Gran Paradiso and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to our friends and anybody who reads this review.We had to rearrange our original booking due to illness and Alberto the owner could not have been more helpful in assisting us.Once we arrived we could see why this hotel was praised by so many guests. Very impressed with the style of the hotel being minimalistic with striking art work spread around the hotel.
reviews.title: well worth a visit

reviews.text: Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff whether reception/dining room/bar staff or shuttle driver together with the maid service who kept our room spotless and yet I never saw her.
reviews.title: Perfect perfect perfect

reviews.text: Both my wife and I thank all involved for making us feel special and our stay so enjoyable and hopefully we will visit again some other time.
reviews.title: Great hotel, amazing views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Joy and Mick Wells(ROOM601)
reviews.title: Fantastic....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from staying at the gran paradiso for our honeymoon. The staff were so friendly and seemed to genuinely care about the guests. The rooms were clean and modern. A sea-view is a MUST because our room was "cliff facing" and although we had a balcony there was not point sitting out there because we just had netting and corrugated iron to look at but this didn't matter because we sat in the restaurant (food delicious EVERY night, and varied choices too) or the bar (delicious cocktails but €7.50 each- beats €8.50 in sorrento though) or by the pool itself (amazing views and pool completely spotless every single day). Only have one 4/5 and that was for location because it's on top of a hill and walking up is tiring and unsuitable for wheelchair users etc but the shuttle bus is regular and reliable.
reviews.title: Just want to say thankyou .
